newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ share prices end weaker as trade thins out.
newsitem.headline: NZ share prices end weaker as trade thins out.

text.p: * New Zealand share prices end slightly weaker
* Trade thins out before budget, monetary policy statement
* Signs of life in Ceramco, Michael Hill, Sky City
Price movements at close

New Zealand share prices ended slightly weaker on Monday as trade thinned out before the budget on Thursday and the Reserve Bank's monetary policy statement (MPS) due the following day.
The NZSE-40 Capital Index, driven mostly by minor falls in the leading issues, ended 8.74 points down at 2,414.87 on turnover worth just NZ$32.2 million.
Telecom was the main driver, losing six cents to NZ$7.28 as the utility aligned itself with its closing price in the U.S. on Friday.
Fletcher Paper lost three to NZ$3.45 but Carter Holt Harvey, which went ex a 5.0 cents per share dividend, ended just three cents down at $3.57.
Phil Hardie Boys at BZW said investors may be holding back before the budget and the MPS, but he said confidence surveys would be the key.
Hardie Boys noted Treasurer Winston Peters' warning last week that budget surpluses would not be as high as some private analysts were forecasting.
"But we're looking more at the confidence surveys to find anecdotal signs of how weak the economy is," he said.
Manufacturer Ceramco exhibited signs of life, gaining six cents to NZ$1.37.
Likewise Sky City was up 15 at NZ$6.90 and Michael Hill International blipped up seven to $1.62, but the rises were all on light volume.
Brierley Investments eased one to to NZ$1.37, with weakness in Thistle Hotels' share price being the most likely cause. -- James Gray (64 9 302 1253)
